item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, October 9, 2024 at 3:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. On the Nature of Time (164 points | 80 comments)
2. The human internet is dying. AI images are taking over Google top results (85 points | 51 comments)
3. My first game with Carimbo, my homemade engine (192 points | 94 comments)
4. Show HN: Winamp and other media players, rebuilt for the web with Web Components (183 points | 37 comments)
5. Differential Transformer (434 points | 153 comments)
6. Rabbit hole: stumbling across two Portuguese punched cards (111 points | 34 comments)
7. Don't let dicts spoil your code (40 points | 28 comments)
8. Trap – Transformers in APL (41 points | 9 comments)
9. Show HN: Kotlin Money (342 points | 189 comments)
10. Practices of Reliable Software Design (52 points | 5 comments)
11. European govt air-gapped systems breached using custom malware (75 points | 46 comments)
12. The Static Site Paradox (320 points | 198 comments)
13. Why the First Pet Cemetery Was Revolutionary (5 points | 3 comments)
14. Lunar Lake's iGPU: Debut of Intel's Xe2 Architecture (46 points | 13 comments)
15. Who died and left the US $7B? (195 points | 166 comments)
16. A modest critique of Htmx (156 points | 44 comments)
17. Canvases versus Documents (47 points | 9 comments)
18. Instant (YC S22) is hiring a founding engineer to help build a modern Firebase ( | hide)
19. Shrinking augmented reality displays into eyeglasses to expand their use (15 points | 2 comments)
20. Nobel Prize in Physics awarded to John Hopfield and Geoffrey Hinton [pdf] (781 points | 694 comments)
21. Teeth as time capsules: Soviet secrets and my dentist grandmother (4 points | discuss)
22. ABC News hacks into popular robot vacuum, watches owner through camera (230 points | 104 comments)
23. Emoji as a Favicon Using SVG (5 points | 1 comment)
24. If the Django Software Foundation had $1M (25 points | 6 comments)
25. Building a robust data synchronization framework with Rails (50 points | 6 comments)
26. My search for the mysterious missing secretary who shaped chatbot history (39 points | 6 comments)
27. A popular but wrong way to convert a string to uppercase or lowercase (142 points | 156 comments)
28. (Re)Using rustc components in gccrs (114 points | 10 comments)
29. Daemonization in Unix programs is probably about restarting programs (64 points | 38 comments)
30. The real data wall is billions of years of evolution (93 points | 63 comments)
